html: 1.9.19  5:17 am   should i follow my brain telling me music isn't right for me and that i'll suck at it and that it's too confusing for me and i'll never be good at it and never learn how to do music good etc etc or should i listen to this intense feeling i have in my gut (that i get when listening to music sometimes) that is saying I DESPERATELY WANT TO LEARN HOW TO PLAY INSTRUMENTS AND MAKE GOOD MUSIC!!!!! it keeps coming back around to me ... the want to be able to make and play music stuff, but .. i keep getting discouraged, because music seems so complicated and all these weird names for these 2985395359835 million chords and note combinations OR WHATEVER YOU CALL THEM keep making me want to rip off my face because i know i'll never be able to understand it all WHAT DO I DO. DO I LISTEN TO MY DISCOURAGEMENT OR DO I LISTEN TO THE MAJOR WANT TO BE ABLE TO DO MUSIC BY THE WAY I HOPE THIS ALL MADE SENSE THANK YOU

1.8.19  11:31 pm   So you seem like someone who is talented when it comes to making yourself get work done. So, I was wondering if I could like pitch you an idea that I thought of trying for myself to start making more music, and see if you had any feedback? idk. The plan would be for me to spend, for each song, three days on the melody, then three days on the harmony, then three days on the percussion, then three days on the bassline, and finish with two days to revise and edit. Do you think this is a good plan? Anyway, love everything you do! Keep it up! <3
